places.name: Dishoom King's Cross
places.address: 5 Stable St, London N1C 4AB, United Kingdom

places.name: Caravan King's Cross
places.address: 1 Granary Square, London N1C 4AA, United Kingdom
places.review_excerpt: I absolutely love the venue here. It’s a really lovely place to sit. We got a few bits to share, the spiced cauliflower which was lovely, the steamed cod dumplings (had too much lemongrass in the sauce for my liking) sti

places.name: Coal Office Restaurant
places.address: 2 Bagley Walk, London N1C 4PQ, United Kingdom
places.review_excerpt: Part of the impressive Coal Drop Yard development behind St Pancras station - the Coal Office cuisine is a mixed, Middle Eastern affair. Shades of Ottolenghi abound. The menu is divided between small bites, mid-sized and

places.name: FIRIN
places.address: 140 York Wy, London N1 0AX, United Kingdom
places.review_excerpt: Went here for a work event so there was about 14 of us. The food was amazing. Meze starters, delicious pide and to die for kebabs/stews. A little on the expensive side but that could be due to our drinks order. Will defi

places.name: Granary Square Brasserie
places.address: 1 Granary Square, London N1C 4AA, United Kingdom
places.review_excerpt: The weekday set lunch is excellent; delicious and great value at £24 nett. I had the calamari to start and the grilled seabream as the main; both were beautifully prepared. The interior décor is impressive, making it a

places.name: Spagnoletti
places.address: 27 Euston Rd., London NW1 2SD, United Kingdom
places.review_excerpt: The first time I went to the restaurant, I felt welcomed, the set up was great and the staff were really friendly. I tried the mushrooms mezzaluna with celeriac broth, loved it but the broth was a bit salty. The staff we

places.name: The Lighterman
places.address: 3 Granary Square, London N1C 4BH, United Kingdom
places.review_excerpt: I was surprised how good the food was (I tried three appetisers, Mama Mia). Amazing food yet amazing view! Please choose the window seat. You will know what I am saying!

places.name: Granger & Co. King's Cross
places.address: Unit 1, The Stanley building, 7 Pancras Sq, London N1C 4AG, United Kingdom
places.review_excerpt: So easy to find, just near King’s Cross Station. We couldn’t book a table in the morning, only walk-ins. Excellent service. There’s both indoor and outdoor seating - since we wanted to sit inside, the staff gave us a ta

places.name: German Gymnasium
places.address: 1 King's Blvd, London N1C 4BU, United Kingdom
places.review_excerpt: German Gymnasium is worth visiting even just for its architecture. The building is beautiful and grand - impressive without feeling intimidating. We visited so as to try their Oktoberfest menu, and the experience was a b

places.name: Morty & Bob's
places.address: 49, Coal Drops Yard, London N1C 4DQ, United Kingdom

places.name: Mildreds Kings Cross
places.address: 200 Pentonville Rd, London N1 9JP, United Kingdom
places.review_excerpt: I'm not vegan and this is probably the only vegan place I've encountered so far that I would frequent more often. Top quality and preparation of meals! Had them pack one of the pancakes because I couldn't finish it, and

places.name: RAILS Restaurant & Little Bar
places.address: Pancras Rd, London N1C 4TB, United Kingdom
places.review_excerpt: The tea service was an interesting experience, and the food was overall good. However, it's all cold bits and you could see the sweating on the chocolate from being held in the fridge, which makes me wonder how truly fre

places.name: Nonos
places.address: 112 Judd St, London WC1H 9NT, United Kingdom
places.review_excerpt: Had an amazing time at “Nonos”. We couldn’t fault it for anything, and had an amazing evening. The food was absolutely delicious, with both the pork and chicken souvlaki being very tender and well spiced. We also got the

places.name: Lina Stores Italian Restaurant & Deli King's Cross
places.address: 20 Stable St, London N1C 4DR, United Kingdom
places.review_excerpt: Nice menu with lots of options. Very friendly service and atmosphere is so cute. Pasta was tasty and well cooked and tasted fresh. The focaccia seemed like it was probably made the day before as the edges were dried out

places.name: Fatto a Mano King's Cross
places.address: Unit 1, 3 Pancras Sq, London N1C 4AG, United Kingdom
places.review_excerpt: Absolutely loved this place! Just tried this Italian pizzeria for the first time and it was such a great experience. The pizza was so good — fresh, full of flavour, and perfectly cooked. The starter was amazing as well!

places.name: Pizza Union King's Cross
places.address: 246-250 Pentonville Rd, London N1 9JY, United Kingdom
places.review_excerpt: Very nice place. Probably the cheapest pizza I ever had in a restaurant. No table service as such but nice service overall. Pizzas very tasty and fresh, thin (but not dry) and still a great deal for the price. Definitely

places.name: Granary Square
places.address: 1 Granary Square, London N1C 4AB, United Kingdom
places.review_excerpt: The best place for everyone. So much to do there with fountains on hot days if you have kids under 10, food market round the corner, plenty restaurants to choose from, canal in front of it to start your lovely walk towar

places.name: Kimchee Restaurant & Bar
places.address: Unit 4, 2 Pancras Sq, London N1C 4AG, United Kingdom

places.name: BAO Kings Cross
places.address: Unit 2, 4 Pancras Sq, London N1C 4DP, United Kingdom

places.name: Drake & Morgan at King's Cross
places.address: 6 Pancras Sq, London N1C 4AG, United Kingdom
places.review_excerpt: We haven’t been down to London for a while so were unaware of Drake and Morgan until we were looking for somewhere to have a coffee. It’s a lovely venue, comfortable, spacious and with stylish decor. We chose to sit insi

news.title: The Servant King: Living a Life of Agape in the Digital Age
news.description:
By Lavoisier Fernandes – Every generation must decide whom it will follow. In our time, the kings we serve are often unseen—algorithms, trends, and screens

news.title: Who was St Edmund the Martyr and why do we remember him?
news.description: 20 November is St Edmund’s Day, celebrating the king and martyr who was once the patron saint of England. This is his story.

news.title: NLD talking points: Injury issues, Eze meets Spurs and set-piece kings do battle

news.title: Today in History: November 18, Robert Blake ordered to pay $30 million in wife’s slaying
news.description: Eight months after Robert Blake was acquitted of murdering his wife at a criminal trial, a civil jury decided the actor was behind the killing and ordered him to pay $30 million to Bonny Lee Bakley’s children.

news.title: Google DeepMind won a Nobel prize for AI: can it produce the next big breakthrough?
news.description: The company was created to use AI for world- changing science — and achieved that with AlphaFold. But the advent of large language models raises deep questions about the future of DeepMind.
